headline: Post-term babies at risk of neurological conditions, death, gynaecologists warn
summarized_story:
Amarachi OkehMaternal and child health experts say pregnant women should seek prompt medical intervention for overdue pregnancy, warning that post-term babies are at risk of neurological deficiencies and death.
Speaking with PUNCH Healthwise in separate interviews, the maternal and child health experts said caregivers must also intervene once pregnancy exceeds 42 weeks.
She also noted that overdue babies are babies born after 42 weeks.
“Once it’s the date of birth, we normally use 40 weeks, we don’t wait till 42 weeks.
In Nigeria, once it is 41 weeks and three days, the woman is induced,” Dr. Kenechukwu said.
